title: (x) sans used in BB&T bank advertising - Bliss {Nick Cooke}
content:
Here in the corporate font that BB&T uses in their adds, etc. It looks very similar to LinoType Aroma, but it ain’t.

Any suggestions? Let me know if you need additional specimens.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [10-21-~1.gif](http://web.archive.org/web/20061114142356/http:/typophile.com/files/10-21-~1.gif) | 21.98 KB |
| [10-23-~1.gif](http://web.archive.org/web/20061114142356/http:/typophile.com/files/10-23-~1.gif) | 45.87 KB |
author: loavesandfishes

comments.content:
It’s hard to tell at that size, but it could be Jeremy Tankard’s Bliss.

Nick Cooke

That was the same conclusion I just reached using the Sans Serif ID Guide — [Bliss](http://web.archive.org/web/20061114142356/http:/www.typography.net/type/bliss.htm).

- Mike Yanega

I’ve uploaded additional specimens. Let me know if the diagnosis is still Bliss.

[http://typophile.com/files/10-23-~1.gif](http://web.archive.org/web/20061114142356/http:/typophile.com/files/10-23-~1.gif)
Hi loavesandfishes, could you please contact me through my profile? Typophile Instant Messaging is not exactly reliable. ;^)
